title: Encryption at Rest - Email Storage
content:
Hi,

I've been using Thunderbird for years now for various email accounts that I mostly used to information I would consider public. Thus while I would take simple and obvious precautions, I wasn't overly concerned with security.

Now, I'm connecting Thunderbird to my personal email accounts, including my ProtonMail account that I do use for private information. I'm happy with the ProtonBridge handles encryption and decryption when you send and receive emails but as I understand it, once on the device, all of your emails are just stored in plain text.

Yes you can put a Password on Thunderbird but that wouldn't deter anyone with any motive. I'm aware many people site FDE as a solution to this problem and while it's part of a solution, I would like an additional layer of security. I would like everything inside of '/home/user/.thunderbird' encrypted at rest. Ideally the Master Password would decrypt it but it's not the end of the world if it's a little more laborious.

From everything I've seen so far, unless I send and receive all of my emails with PGP, my emails will be stored plain text on my PC. Perhaps installing Thunderbird inside a veracrypt volume is the only option?

Any advice would be appreciated.
creator: chattysiddy

title: Нужна помощь
content:
Добрый день, всем любителям почтового клиента Thuderbird!

У меня така незадача:

У меня две учетные записи: 1. tradmir@mail.ru 2. radmir1948@gmail.com

Все было нормально, пока кому-то с mail.ru не взбрело в голову, что мой адрес tradmir@mail.ru небезопасен, и потребовали сменить пароль. Что раз просят, я сменил...

А этот почтовый сервис еще страдает болезненным недоверием к своим клиентам, и все сторонние почтовые клиенты должны иметь отдельный пароль, в том числе Thunderbird...

У меня был такой пароль, и Thunderbird работал нормально, его я не менял, спрашивается зачем, какое отношение оно имеет к пароль на mail.ru? В итоге, я остался без почты на своем ПК с операционной системой Windows 7! Более того, теперь, отключилась и вторая учетная запись!

Почтового клиента mail.ru для ПК нет, предлагается ставит мобильное приложение mail.ru, ставит эмулятор и запускать его на эмуляторе! Чего ради?

Честно скажу, моя почта не содержит ничего стоящего внимания, чтобы ее нужно было защищать: только переписками с программистскими форумами по программистким ситуациям, перемалывание косточек друзьям, просто сплетни, да и что вы хотите от старпера в 75 лет? От mail.ru я скорее всего откажусь, хотя тогда я потеряю связь со многими партнерами и аккаунтами, где была указана моя учетная запись на mail.ru. Но за что меня лишили доступа к gmail.com?

Объясните, что происходит? С уважением, Радмир P.S. Поскольку эти две почты для меня закрыты, присылайте ваши комментарии и ответы на rakenurp@gmail.com

Радмир.

The message count discrepancy doesn't seem to be causing any other problems. I just worry about anomalies. Any ideas? Thank you.

title: Deleted emails reappear in my Thunderbird inbox again and again. How can I finally delete them?
content:
I installed an IMAP email account in Thunderbird and about 600 emails appeared in the inbox. That seemed to be ok. I deleted them all (didn't need them) and also cleared the "deleted items" bin. However, every time I open Thunderbird all those messages re-appear in my inbox. I do the same (delete and then clear) and they still reappear in the inbox again.

This happens just in Thunderbird. If I web access to my email account all these messages do not exist, so I believe it is a sort of backup or cache in Thunderbird. I deleted Thunderbird cache in "settings, network and space disk" and marked it to be deleted every time I turn it off. No matter this... the 600 messages come back again and again.

Thunderbird 128.7.0esr (64-bit) Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS

Does anyone know a solution to this problem?

Thanks.

title: Do these plugins exist? If not, please make them, I need them!
content:
Do these plugins exist? If not, please make them, I need them!

1) The plugin lets you make filters for all mailboxes and folders, or for any selection of them, rather than for just a single folder/mailbox. Some things I filter for may arrive in any of several mailboxes, depending on the address I used, and it's a drag to create the same filter for each of them.

2) The plugin lets you search in specific mailboxes or folders, or for any selection of them, without having to wade through masses of irrelevant results from other folders.

3) The plugin shows you, in search results, what folder each email is in. Currently, when I do a search, each folder containing any results is on the list showing how many results it contains, and if I click on it I can see those results, but that's not the same - and it goes away when the results are shown as a list.

Thank you.
creator: firefox2367

title: iOS Version
content:
I love Mozilla Thunderbird and after years away came back and still love it over Outlook. However, I do use iOS and was disappointed to see no version. Yes, I have donated and wondered, what would it take to have a seperate donation option to allow funding towards an iOS version, not just Android? I would rather help donate towards getting that done than have to use outlook on my iOS device and Thunderbird everywhere else. Would the developers and community get behind this? If everyone interested could donate even only $5 a month for a set time (maybe 12 months) to see it happen, I would jump on board. What is the possibility of somehow making this happen. Hopefully enough iOS users getting on board would make this viable.

Can we make this a 2025 goal for all iOS users?
